## Initializing a Repository {.flexbox .vcenter}
<div class="centered">
This is where Git stores its database and configuration information, so that it can track your project.
</div>

## Checking the status of the repository {.flexbox .vcenter}
<p style="font-size:50px"> git status</p>

You can see your currently branch, unstagged files, stagged files 
<p>HEAD is git slang for “the branch you’re currently working on”</p>

## Basic Workflow {.flexbox .vcenter}
<p style="font-size:60px"> git add [file]</p>
Stage the files to be commited

## Basic Workflow { .flexbox .vcenter}
<p style="font-size:60px"> git commmit -m "message"</p>
Once you have staged the files, you can commit

HINT: git commit --amend

## Basic Workflow { .flexbox .vcenter}
<p style="font-size:60px">git push [origin] [branch]</p>
Put your commits with your code on the server

## Initial Configurarion {.flexbox .vcenter}
<pre class="prettyprint" data-lang="Shell - Git">
git config --global user.name 'William'</p>
git config --global user.email 'williamjamir@gmail.com'</p>
git config --global color.ui 'auto'
</pre>

## Hands On - Git Lab {.flexbox .vcenter}
<pre class="prettyprint" data-lang="Shell - Git">
git clone git@gitlab.com:williamjamir/example.git
cd example
touch README.md
git add README.md
git commit -m "add README"
git push -u origin master
</pre>

## Commands from previous image 

<p style="font-size:50px"> git reset </p>
Remove the file that is going to be commited

<p style="font-size:50px"> git checkout  </p>
Copies files from the stage to the working directory. 
Use this to throw away local changes.

## Branching {.flexbox .vcenter}
Branches are used to develop features isolated from each other. 
<p>The master branch is the "default" branch when you create a repository. </p>

## Branching {.flexbox .vcenter}
<p style="font-size:30px"> Create a new branch named "feature" and switch to it </p>
<pre class="prettyprint"> git checkout -b feature </pre>

## Branching {.flexbox .vcenter}
<img src="images/branch.png" alt="Drawing" style="width: 200px;"/>

## Deleting a Branch {.flexbox .vcenter}
<p style="font-size:30px">  Switch back to master </p>
<pre class="prettyprint"> git checkout master </pre>
<p style="font-size:30px">  Delete the branch </p>
<pre class="prettyprint" > git branch -d feature_x </pre>

## Branch at remote repository {.flexbox .vcenter}
<p style="font-size:30px">  A branch is not available to others unless you push the branch to your remote repository </p>
<pre class="prettyprint"> git push origin <branch> </pre>

## Update  {.flexbox .vcenter}
<p style="font-size:30px">  To update your local repository to the newest commit, execute </p>
<pre class="prettyprint"> git pull </pre>

## Merge  {.flexbox .vcenter}
<p style="font-size:30px"> To merge another branch into your active branch use </p>
<pre class="prettyprint"> git merge <branch> </pre>

## Merge {.flexbox .vcenter}
<img src="images/merge.png" alt="Drawing" style="width: 600px;"/>

## Comparing files / branchs  {.flexbox .vcenter}

<pre class="prettyprint"> Git diff </pre>

## Conflicts  {.flexbox .vcenter}

In branch-a, you wrote the word "nine," but your friend wrote "eight." 
<pre class="prettyprint"> 
the number of planets are
<<<<<<< HEAD
nine
=======
eight
>>>>>>> branch-a
 </pre>

<p>Git automatically adds conflict markers to the affected areas. </p>
